intro: Euploca pilosa, commonly known as the hairy euploca, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Euploca pilosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in wetland environments.
